title.rendered: What are NFTs?  A guide for investors |  cryptocurrencies

content.rendered:
The king of cryptocurrencies, Bitcoin, has had a rocky start to the year, down roughly 6.9% since the start of 2022, but the market an area or setting, online or offline, in which business dealings are conducted. of non-fungible tokens, or NFTs, is booming with investors, institutions, businesses and celebrities piling into digital tokens as their value tends to rise.

The total value of NFTs grew from $100 million in 2020 to more than $21 billion in 2021, according to a report by TradingPlatforms.

You may have heard of the Bored Monkey Yacht Club NFTs, one of the most famous NFT collections, a whimsical series of unique images depicting a monkey with different personalities. But now, big brand companies have entered the NFT market. Luxury car company Mercedes-Benz has collaborated with NFT artists to create an exclusive NFT collection, Nike Inc. (ticker: NKE) acquired digital sneaker brand RTFKT to expand its digital presence, and Walmart Inc. (WMT ) could enter the metaverse A metaverse is a digital universe that contains all aspects of the real world, such as real-time interactions and economies. It offers a unique experience to end users. with potential plans to offer their own cryptocurrency Cryptocurrencies are digital currencies that use cryptographic technologies to ensure their operation. and a collection of NFTs.

For investors who want a piece of the NFT pie, here’s what to know about NFTs and how to manage them:

  • What are NFTs and how do they work?
  • NFTs and art.
  • Buying and selling NFTs as an investment.

What are NFTs non-exchangeable token, a type of cryptographic token, each instance of which is unique (specific) and cannot be exchanged or replaced by another similar token, although tokens are often interchangeable in nature. and how do they work?

NFTs are non-fungible tokens. Fungibility refers to assets of the same type that can be exchanged for each other. Bitcoins, for example, are fungible, users can change change – a concept relevant to cryptocurrencies using the UTXO model – is the number of coins returned to a user after the user uses their unspent outputs to initiate a transaction. a Bitcoin the largest and most popular cryptocurrency in the world. It is a decentralized digital currency that allows users to conduct trustless peer-to-peer transactions. for another, and it will be exactly the same asset.

But since NFTs are not fungible, each token a digital unit designed with utility in mind, providing access to and use of a broader crypto-economic system. it is unique and cannot be replicated. Due to this distinctive feature, NFTs are represented as tokens on the blockchain that represent digital property. This ownership record cannot be changed, as its existence is recorded in the blockchain.

“NFTs are pieces of information on a blockchain that are represented in an interactive format with visual representation,” says Nick Donaraski, general manager of blockchain technology, ORE System. As for ownership rights, if an NFT is acquired early, that asset is limited and only available if you own it. This scarcity, says Donaraski, is what allows the value of the NFT to grow over time.

The management of NFTs is the same as the management of cryptocurrencies, which can be done in a mobile application or in a web application. With user-friendly cryptocurrency exchanges like Coinbase is an American company that operates a cryptocurrency exchange platform. Global Inc. (COIN), Binance and FTX, these can all be done on a smartphone, but this could leave your tokens open to scams or hacks.

Experts say that one of the most important aspects of managing NFTs is maintaining security The term security refers to a fungible and negotiable financial instrument that carries a type of monetary value. of your tokens. Like cryptocurrencies, NFTs are held in wallets. Inside the wallet, there is a unique link that allows you to display the content or make transactions with it. “You can take an NFT from one market to another as long as they are on the same blockchain and support that type of NFT,” says Donaraski.

Storage or access to NFTs can be done through a digital wallet digital technologies are those electronic tools that have the ability to generate, store or even process data. or hardware. This is the place where users can save, receive and purchase their NFTs. Digital or online wallets, such as Metamask, Coinbase Wallet a place where cryptocurrency users can store, send and receive digital assets. or AlphaWallet, are protected by a long password or passphrase. This is a private key that is used to authorize transactions. It is a standard way of storing NFTs, but can be vulnerable to cyber attacks.

Donaraski says that password management is of the utmost importance and that the private key must always be protected. “Your private key is your password, and you should consider it as important as your birth certificate,” he says. “If someone accesses the private key, they have access to everything in the wallet.”

NFTs and art

NFTs represent a physical or digital asset. It can be anything from intellectual rights to title to an asset. NFTs have expanded into gaming, retail, real estate, sports, and other fields. As the utility of NFTs expands, their adoption and popularity will follow.

But NFTs are especially well known in the context of digital art. Artists create NFTs, which can then be traded on a marketplace. But NFTs can also be exploited in different ways.

NFTs are unique due to their verified ownership that cannot be replicated or tampered with. When an item is limited, it becomes more valuable. The market for NFTs is speculative, and people buy NFTs because they believe they will be more valuable to someone else later on. Therefore, people collect art NFTs because they believe they will be valuable in the future.

Buying and selling NFTs as an investment

The traditional principle of investing, buy low and sell high, also applies to NFTs. Market participants can buy into NFTs ahead of time and turn around and sell them for a profit. However, “NFTs should be viewed as an investment that could go to zero and is pure speculation,” says Daniel Strachman, managing partner of A&C Advisors.

“There are NFTs you can buy that you can flip right away and others that you can hold,” says Strachman.

NFTs are not like a stock or bond where you know what the intrinsic value of that investment is. They have a market value that depends on what the cryptocurrency community is willing to pay for them.

Knowing that NFTs are risky assets, investors need to determine the level of exposure to them. “You would have a certain amount of money that you would put in your capital bucket Capital is commonly defined as the large sum of money that is used to invest. risk, and that would be what you’re willing to go to zero or 100 », he says. Another way to think about NFT exposure, according to Strachman, is that if investors have exposure to cryptocurrencies, NFTs could be a subset of that exposure.

Strachman says that investors can think of NFTs as an asset similar to silver, gold, and art. “When people buy art as an investment, it’s an illiquid part of their portfolio,” he says. “Some would call it part of an assignment allotment is the awarding of shares or tokens that can be earned, purchased, or set aside for a team, group, investor, institution, or other similar entity. raw material”. A similar aspect to NFT commodities, says Strachman, is that they are “completely uncorrelated” to any other market in existence.

Experts say that your individual long-term investment goals a situation where a cryptocurrency is bought with the expectation of selling it at a higher price for a profit later. term should determine the type of NFT you want to look for. “You have to find NFTs that align with what your portfolio growth is, just like any other investment,” says Donaraski.

Some NFTs may offer investors greater growth opportunities, depending on their applications, Donaraski says. NFTs with utility, such as real estate contracts, will end up having higher value in the future.

An NFT can be a legitimate investment if investors understand what the NFT is used for. “Making sure you have something that has utility is a better bet for long-term living than an NFT is,” says Donaraski. “If the NFT has utility, whatever the lifetime of the use case is, it is the lifetime of that utility.”

To carry out

The most important thing before investors enter the NFT market is to do their research. It’s no different than researching a stock or bond to see what they’re getting into. Market participants too often get carried away with madness, says Strachman, which is good for those selling them but bad for those buying them. To make better decisions, it is best to understand what investors are getting into.
